intro: Lopezia racemosa, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
